section.p:
Altair platform architectures consist of:
Arango Database (third-party software) – a multi-model database that provides storage capability and a graph model. The database provides Search capability and it indexes the data based on the index definition.
Redits (third-party software) for distributed data structure implementation
NATS Event Bus (third-party software)
Root Gateway
API Gateway – a downstream gateway that calls the Object Store
Authentication Server - Receive Request, Authenticate the user, give JWT token and forward the request to the downstream configured services
– a core engine handling configuration and execution
Environment Manager – a service that curates the execution environment. For example, PBS and OpenFaaS. This is responsible for authoring the content definition and deployed in the execution environment. Manages the health of the environment such as server going down, bringing it up, and addresses the different functions.
